headline.print_headline: White House Losing Pastry Chef Bill Yosses in June
headline.main: White House Losing Pastry Chef Bill Yosses in June

docs.lead_paragraph: Bill Yosses has baked and built his last gingerbread White House.
docs.snippet: Bill Yosses has baked and built his last gingerbread White House.

headline.print_headline: The Gun Lobby’s Latest Bizarre Crusade
headline.main: The Gun Lobby’s Latest Bizarre Crusade

docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes campaign by the National Rifle Assn that is exerting pressure on some Democrats to oppose Dr Vivek Murthy, Pres Obama's nominee to become surgeon general, because of his attitudes on gun control; holds that Murthy is impeccably qualified and represents no threat to the gun rights of law-abiding citizens.
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.R.A. has attacked President Obama’s nominee for surgeon general, and now Democratic leaders might knuckle under the pressure.
docs.snippet: The N.R.A. has attacked President Obama’s nominee for surgeon general, and now Democratic leaders might knuckle under the pressure.

docs.lead_paragraph: A doctor faults senators for their objection to the president’s nominee for surgeon general.
docs.snippet: A doctor faults senators for their objection to the president’s nominee for surgeon general.

headline.print_headline: In China, Michelle Obama to Stay Firmly in 'Mom in Chief' Mode
headline.main: In China, Michelle Obama to Stay Firmly in 'Mom in Chief' Mode

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. first lady Michelle Obama is expected to steer clear of controversial issues such as human rights when she visits China this week but her trip could help advance a top item on her husband's foreign policy agenda: deepening Washington's ties with Beijing.
docs.snippet: U.S. first lady Michelle Obama is expected to steer clear of controversial issues such as human rights when she visits China this week but her trip could help advance a top item on her husband's foreign policy agenda: deepening Washington's ties with...

headline.print_headline: A Plunge in U.S. Preschool Obesity? Not So Fast, Experts Say
headline.main: A Plunge in U.S. Preschool Obesity? Not So Fast, Experts Say

docs.lead_paragraph: If the news last month that the prevalence of obesity among American preschoolers had plunged 43 percent in a decade sounded too good to be true, that's because it probably was, researchers say.
docs.snippet: If the news last month that the prevalence of obesity among American preschoolers had plunged 43 percent in a decade sounded too good to be true, that's because it probably was, researchers say.

headline.print_headline: Income Gap, Meet the Longevity Gap
headline.main: Income Gap, Meet the Longevity Gap

docs.abstract: Wealthy Fairfax County, Va, and blue-collar McDowell County, W Va, illustrate the growing divide in life expectancy between affluent and struggling areas of the United States; gap has widened over past decade, with men living an average of 82 years in Fairfax and only 64 years in McDowell.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two counties, separated by fortune and 350 miles, demonstrate the widening divide in life expectancy between affluent and struggling areas of the United States.
docs.snippet: Two counties, separated by fortune and 350 miles, demonstrate the widening divide in life expectancy between affluent and struggling areas of the United States.
